metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6786 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
kernel/events/core.c in the performance subsystem in the Linux kernelbefore 4.0 mismanages locks during certain migrations, which allows localusers to gain privileges via a crafted application, aka Android internalbug 30955111.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1077.82
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-snapdragon - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
